name: Row Row Row Your Boat
source: Traditional melody, verified from multiple music education sources. Common notation uses 6/8 or 4/4 time. This version uses simplified 4/4 rhythm suitable for early childhood education.
notes: This is one of the most famous children's rounds/canons. The melody is in C major using only the pentatonic scale plus F. The 'merrily' section features rapid eighth notes alternating between high C5 and lower notes. First published with this melody in 1881 in The Franklin Square Song Collection. Song is in the public domain.
